entries.meaning: Something reworked, or made up from old materials.
examples: He wrote a bad rehash of an earlier essay.

entries.meaning: (computing) A recomputation of the structure of a hash table, taking into account any newly added items.

verbs.description: rehash (third-person singular simple present rehashes, present participle rehashing, simple past and past participle rehashed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To hash (chop food into small pieces) again.

examples: Today's parliamentary session only rehashed last week's arguments.
The CEO of the company only rehashed a speech for the news conference.
The general rehashed plans for the war.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To analyze a prior contentious or embarrassing event.
examples: Let's not rehash what we did last night.

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To recompute the structure of a hash table, taking into account any newly added items.
